title: Revolt At Carcino
opening: Carcino has betrayed Frelia and joined forces with Grado. Carcino’s troops stop Prince Innes, blocking his way to Jehanna. With soldiers occupying the road forward and back, he is trapped in a hopeless situation. Eirika rushes to the prince’s aid.

intro.speaker: Vigarde
intro.line: General Glen of the Grado Imperial Army, also known as the Sunstone...

intro.speaker: Glen
intro.line: Yes...

intro.speaker: Vigarde
intro.line: Your orders. Capture the leader of the rebel army in Carcino. Capture Eirika.

intro.speaker: Glen
intro.line: Eirika... Do you mean the princess of Renais?

intro.speaker: Vigarde
intro.line: Eirika invaded Carcino. She massacred the citizens of Port Kiris. Then, she fled south. Glen. Go. Crush the rebels who brought ruin to Carcino.

intro.speaker: Glen
intro.line: ...Understood, sire.

intro.speaker: Cormag
intro.line: What did the emperor say, Brother?

intro.speaker: Glen
intro.line: I’ve been ordered to kill the princess of Renais. Cormag, I want you to remain here in the capital. I’ll go alone.

intro.speaker: Cormag
intro.line: If that’s what you want, Brother, so be it. But you seem troubled... Don’t tell me you’re concerned about fighting the princess of a ruined land!

intro.speaker: Glen
intro.line: ...Hm... I never was able to slip anything past you, little brother. You’re right. This duty falls heavily on my shoulders, more then any other.

intro.speaker: Cormag
intro.line: Tell me, Brother, do you know this princess?

intro.speaker: Glen
intro.line: Yes. When Renais and Grado were still close... I met the girl– I met Eirika only once. We spoke briefly, but I felt she was a woman of great kindness. I cannot bring myself to believe Princess Eirika is evil. I cannot.

intro.speaker: Cormag
intro.line: ...Glen. The emperor has ordered–

intro.speaker: Glen
intro.line: There’s the rub, Cormag. That’s it exactly. His Majesty has never spoken a falsehood in all the time I’ve served him. And as a servant of the empire, I am duty bound to obey his orders. But I can see no reason to think Princess Eirika’s heart is any less gentle now.

intro.speaker: Valter
intro.line: What are these cowardly mutterings? It is because you three generals are weak that we others must work so hard. And yet you get the honor of killing the girl. How I long to do your duty for you!

intro.speaker: Glen
intro.line: Rrrr! Valter, you treacherous swine...

intro.speaker: Valter
intro.line: What’s this? Is this how you speak toward your peer knights of the realm? Lest you’ve forgotten, I, too, am a general–the same rank as you.

intro.speaker: Glen
intro.line: You wretch. You were cast out from the army for mistreating civilians. What lies have you told to receive pardon and reinstatement at the same tome?

intro.speaker: Valter
intro.line: Our beloved emperor felt my skills were needed, and his word is law. His majesty has earned my sincerest and most undying gratitude. And then we have you three. Duessel, Selena, and you... The three of you have proven to be unreliable time and time again. We were brought in to plug the holes, don’t you see? You ought to thank me, Glen!

intro.speaker: Cormag
intro.line: Valter! If you dare insult my brother further...

intro.speaker: Valter
intro.line: Come now, Cormag. And what would you do to me if I did? Would you fight me? Here? Would you show such disloyalty to the emperor?

intro.speaker: Glen
intro.line: Peace, Cormag. We are His Majesty’s men. We will honor his commands. Mark my words, Valter: your crimes are neither forgotten nor forgiven.

intro.speaker: Valter
intro.line: Hmph...

intro.speaker: Gerik
intro.line: Prince Innes. What do you say? Can you continue?

intro.speaker: Innes
intro.line: Yes, of course. Do you believe this is enough to make me give up? I am surprised you mercenaries haven’t turned and fled, though.

intro.speaker: Gerik
intro.line: Naw. You see, Gerik’s Mercenaries takes its name from me, Gerik. I’m the chief here. If I quit while our employer still fought on, they’d want a new name, you follow me? So... What’s the plan?

intro.speaker: Innes
intro.line: Same as before. We remain surrounded. They’re not going to allow us simply to walk out of here... I send a messenger off with news of our plight. However, even on the wings of a pegasus knight, Frelia is days away. We can expect no help from them.

intro.speaker: Gerik
intro.line: So we tighten our belts and survive, is that it? Or would you rather quit this place and rest in comfort?

intro.speaker: Innes
intro.line: Surrender? I’m the prince of Frelia. I don’t know the meaning of the words. The fate of the world rides on my shoulders, and I’ll make it to Jehanna. Even if I have to crawl to do it.

intro.speaker: Gerik
intro.line: Now, that makes me feel better. If you’re so determined, we may all live a little while longer...

intro.speaker: Tethys
intro.line: Hey, Chief, Prince.

intro.speaker: Gerik
intro.line: What is it, Tethys?

intro.speaker: Tethys
intro.line: I’ve got bad news...and then I’ve got worse news.

intro.speaker: Gerik
intro.line: What’s the bad news?

intro.speaker: Tethys
intro.line: We’ve no more weapons in reserve. What you’re holding is what we’ve got. Once those are gone, there won’t be much fight left in us.

intro.speaker: Gerik
intro.line: That is bad news... Well? What’s the worse news?

intro.speaker: Tethys
intro.line: They’ve begun to move. They’re going to attack again. Looks like they’re sending up the whole lot of ’em this time.

intro.speaker: Innes
intro.line: ...... Right. You two, you’re done here. Discharged. Fired. Whatever. You can surrender or flee. The choice is yours.

intro.speaker: Gerik
intro.line: What?

intro.speaker: Innes
intro.line: I’m the one they’re after. Throw down your weapons, and you’ll walk away alive. I don’t need you here. You’ll only be in my way. Who knows? You filthy sellswords’ll probably sell me out anyway.

intro.speaker: Tethys
intro.line: Hold on there! That’s not true, and you know it!

intro.speaker: Gerik
intro.line: Peace, Tethys. Hey, Prince. What are you going to do?

intro.speaker: Innes
intro.line: I’m going to get out of here on my own. I’ll break to the south and escape into the mountains.

intro.speaker: Gerik
intro.line: That ain’t gonna be easy. How you plan on doing that?

intro.speaker: Innes
intro.line: I’m not telling you. I’ve no idea when you’ll decide to betray me. Go on. Get out of here. I’d rather do this alone.

intro.speaker: Gerik
intro.line: Sounds like you’re trying to make sure you’re the only one who dies.

intro.speaker: Innes
intro.line: ...... Fool. I’ve no intention of dying. But there can be no false hope of reinforcements riding in to save the day. You and I are not the same. You’re a commoner, and I’m Frelia’s heir. We of noble birth do not shirk the duties to which we are born.

intro.speaker: Innes
intro.line: What are you waiting for? You may go.

intro.speaker: Gerik
intro.line: Well played, milord. I’ve always loved the melodrama of martyrdom... There’s no way I can abandon you after that fine performance. I’m staying with you. To the end.

intro.speaker: Innes
intro.line: To the– What are you saying? You dare ignore the orders of the one who’s paying your wages?!

intro.speaker: Gerik
intro.line: Tethys, I want you to go and surrender. Give my regards to Ewan and Marisa.

intro.speaker: Tethys
intro.line: Don’t be ridiculous. I’m not going anywhere. Now would the two of you kindly stop acting like such...men? And you! You’ve already fired us. You can’t order us to leave now.

intro.speaker: Innes
intro.line: Unbelievable... And you people call yourselves mercenaries? I thought you fought for money, not for duty.

intro.speaker: Gerik
intro.line: Yeah, that’s one of the rules. Guess we’re lousy mercenaries, eh? Now let’s get thinking. We still need a plan to get us all out of here alive. You’re supposed to be a good tactician, so I figure I won’t die easily. Tell us what to do, Prince. We’ll follow your orders.

intro.speaker: Innes
intro.line: ...... Hm. Very well. I’ll see what I can do to avoid getting us filled with arrows.

intro.speaker: Tethys
intro.line: Ah... Say, Prince. If, by some miracle, aid were to come, from what direction would it arrive?

intro.speaker: Innes
intro.line: ...From the north. But there’s little or no hope of that. Even if Frelia were to send us aid, they would not arrive until...

intro.speaker: Tethys
intro.line: This may be good news... Then again, it may be more bad news. There. On that northern mountain path... Someone’s coming.

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: Prince Innes!

intro.speaker: Seth
intro.line: Princess Eirika, the prince is surrounded by the mercenary armies of Carcino. He looks vastly outnumbered. I doubt he can hold out much longer.

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: I can see that. Let’s hurry!

battle.speaker: Pablo
battle.line: Heh heh... My plan to get rid of Klimt has yielded some unexpected fruit. The head of Frelia’s Prince Innes will make a fine gift to Grado.

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: Lord Pablo, Prince Innes and his men have taken refuge in a mountain stronghold. Do we have your permission to finish them off?

battle.speaker: Pablo
battle.line: Yes. Flush the prince out and cut him down. We’ll find Klimt later and roast his old bones as well. Heh heh heh...

battle.speaker: Man
battle.line: Lord Klimt, Pablo’s troops are moving toward the stronghold. It looks like they’re planning on chasing down Prince Innes and his men.

battle.speaker: Klimt
battle.line: Pablo, you mad, reckless imbecile... If Prince Innes dies here, the bond between Carcino and Frelia is sundered forever. Carcino will be nothing more than a vassal paying tribute to Grado... We must find some way to aid Prince Innes.

battle.speaker: Man
battle.line: Wait, my lord Klimt! Pablo is after you as well. If you reveal yourself here...

battle.speaker: Klimt
battle.line: Ahh... May fortune keep you safe, Prince Innes...

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: Hey! You’re up! You’re getting paid a lot more than us common soldiers. Time you earned your gold!

battle.speaker: Marisa
battle.line: I hear you. Where do I start killing?

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: Th-that way! The Frelian troops! Don’t point that blade in our direction!

battle.speaker: Marisa
battle.line: I’ll do what I can. No promises. Good day.

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: Whew... So that’s Marisa, the Crimson Flash of Gerik’s Mercenaries... She’s a beauty, but I’ll keep my distance...and keep my head.

recruit-talk.speaker: Tana
recruit-talk.line: Brother!

recruit-talk.speaker: Innes
recruit-talk.line: Tana?!? What? How did... What are you doing here?

recruit-talk.speaker: Tana
recruit-talk.line: I came with Eirika. Wait here, Brother. It’s my turn to protect you.

recruit-talk.speaker: Innes
recruit-talk.line: Stop playing the soldier, Tana. You will return to the palace at once.

recruit-talk.speaker: Tana
recruit-talk.line: I will not! Eirika, Ephraim, and you are all risking so much... I can’t sit at home and watch! I have to do something to help.

recruit-talk.speaker: Innes
recruit-talk.line: Tana... ...We’ll talk about this later. For now, we join forces with Eirika.

recruit-talk.speaker: Tana
recruit-talk.line: Thank you, Brother.

recruit-talk.speaker: Eirika
recruit-talk.line: Prince Innes! Are you well?

recruit-talk.speaker: Innes
recruit-talk.line: Eirika... Is that you?

recruit-talk.speaker: Eirika
recruit-talk.line: We’ve come to aid you. You must be exhausted. Please fall back and rest. We’ll take care of these dogs.

recruit-talk.speaker: Innes
recruit-talk.line: I cannot allow that. I will not run and hide while a woman protects me... We will continue the fight. You can join us.

recruit-talk.speaker: Eirika
recruit-talk.line: If that’s how you want it. Let’s go then.

recruit-talk.speaker: Innes
recruit-talk.line: ...Eirika, a moment.

recruit-talk.speaker: Eirika
recruit-talk.line: Prince?

recruit-talk.speaker: Innes
recruit-talk.line: I would give you my thanks. You, the princess of Renais, came to my aid... ...I am in your debt.

recruit-talk.speaker: Innes
recruit-talk.line: Reinforcements have arrived, Gerik.

recruit-talk.speaker: Gerik
recruit-talk.line: Lucky us, eh? Good thing we held out as long as we did.

recruit-talk.speaker: Innes
recruit-talk.line: That was your doing. Thank you.

recruit-talk.speaker: Gerik
recruit-talk.line: Don’t let your guard down now, Prince. There are still enemies to fight, and it’d be such a shame to die now.

recruit-talk.speaker: Innes
recruit-talk.line: I agree completely. Let’s go.

recruit-talk.speaker: Gerik
recruit-talk.line: Hey, Tethys. Looks like help is on the way.

recruit-talk.speaker: Tethys
recruit-talk.line: Really? Perhaps faith is a good thing. I’ve never had much before, but perhaps good things do happen to good people.

recruit-talk.speaker: Gerik
recruit-talk.line: Good things? I like the sound of that. What do you suppose might come my way?

recruit-talk.speaker: Tethys
recruit-talk.line: Ha ha... I wonder...

recruit-talk.speaker: Innes
recruit-talk.line: Reinforcements have arrived, Tethys.

recruit-talk.speaker: Tethys
recruit-talk.line: Really? Perhaps faith is a good thing. I’ve never had much before, but perhaps good things do happen to good people.

recruit-talk.speaker: Innes
recruit-talk.line: Faith had nothing to do with this. Let’s go. We must join them.

recruit-talk.speaker: Tethys
recruit-talk.line: What a strange nobleman.

recruit-talk.speaker: Tethys
recruit-talk.line: Say, Chief. I’ve got good news, and I’ve got better news.

recruit-talk.speaker: Gerik
recruit-talk.line: Eh? What’s the good news?

recruit-talk.speaker: Tethys
recruit-talk.line: Within our band of mercenaries... There are two women enamored of you.

recruit-talk.speaker: Gerik
recruit-talk.line: Huh? What’re you talking about? You a fortune-teller now? And what’s the better news?

recruit-talk.speaker: Tethys
recruit-talk.line: Help has arrived. Looks like we may survive after all.

visit.speaker: Young Lady
visit.line: Elder Pablo used his fortune to build his own private army. Now he’s using it to wrest control of Carcino from the council’s hands... Please...help Lord Klimt, so that he can help us.

visit.speaker: Man
visit.line: You know we have no king in the Republic of Carcino. We’re governed instead by a council of elders. It’s a lot better than any stuffy, old monarchy, I can tell you that. You see, anyone can be a leader in Carcino if he’s old enough. Of course, maybe that’s why the country’s in such a mess right now.

visit.speaker: Young Man
visit.line: I’ve heard that Prince Innes of Frelia is a fantastic tactician. Grado took Renais with no trouble, but Frelia still has yet to fall. They say it’s because Prince Innes has spies reporting every move the empire makes. At the same time, all enemy spies in Frelia are exposed and executed swiftly. That means that none of Frelia’s secrets are ever reported back to the empire. I’ve never met Prince Innes, but he doesn’t sound like a man you’d want as an enemy.

visit.speaker: Gerik
visit.line: What a mess... Looks like the guild bungled. They’re usually diligent about making sure this sort of thing doesn’t happen. But here we are, two people of the same troop, working for opposite sides.

visit.speaker: Gerik
visit.line: Aye, well, that’s a good question... As a mercenary, your loyalty should always lie with the person paying your wages. You decide. We can cross blade if you want, but I’d rather you retreat. ‘Course, if you betray your employer, you’ll soil your sterling name.

visit.speaker: Marisa
visit.line: C’mon, Chief. What would YOU like me to do?

visit.speaker: Gerik
visit.line: Well, that’s easy. I’d like you to come over and join my side.

visit.speaker: Gerik
visit.line: Ho-hold on... Is that it? Just like that? You know what this will do to your reputation, right?

boss.speaker: Pablo
boss.line: No one can withstand the might of Grado... Logic dictates we join now or be subjugated later. I made the rational decision. The only decision!

boss.speaker: Pablo
boss.line: Urrgh... N-no. I cannot die when there is such wealth to be had... Re-retreat! Mercenaries, to me!

end.speaker: Valter
end.line: ...I’ve found you, Eirika. Seems you’re as skilled as reports say. This is going to be fun. Yes, yes, yes. I do so love strong women.

end.speaker: Soldier
end.line: Shall we attack, General Valter?

end.speaker: Valter
end.line: No, we’ll pass on dessert for now. Allow them to escape. We’re leaving.

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: Prince Innes, are you well?

end.speaker: Innes
end.line: Eirika...I’m sorry for troubling you.

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: No, it was no trouble.

end.speaker: Klimt
end.line: Oh, Prince Innes! Thank goodness, you’re unharmed!

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: Who are you?

end.speaker: Klimt
end.line: Oh, where are my manners? I am a member of Carcino’s Council of Elders. My name is Klimt.

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: A council member?

end.speaker: Innes
end.line: So you’re one of the traitors who ordered–

end.speaker: Klimt
end.line: P-please, please! I have no intention of opposing you or quarreling with you. I, too, have been marked for death by Pablo...

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: What is this all about?

end.speaker: Klimt
end.line: It’s a shameful tale... Carcino is a nation divided. As you know, Carcino has no king but is ruled by a council. But now the council has broken apart into factions mired in discord...

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: Factions... You’re saying that the whole of Carcino has not betrayed Frelia?

end.speaker: Klimt
end.line: Correct. The moderate factions prefer to preserve our alliance with Frelia. Pablo’s faction wishes to endear us to Grado, to surrender us to their armies. Once Pablo realized he couldn’t ply us with brides, he began to have us assassinated. Those of us who remain have taken refuge underground. We oppose him where we can. If you hadn’t shown up, I’m not certain I would still be breathing...

end.speaker: Innes
end.line: I do recall enemy troops combing this area when I arrived... They were searching for you, is that it?

end.speaker: Klimt
end.line: Pablo has usurped rule of the council. We had no choice but to hide. Not all of Carcino’s council has gone over to Grado’s side, though... You must believe me–the whole of Carcino does not believe as Pablo does.

end.speaker: Innes
end.line: ...I see.

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: Lord Klimt... I understand the hardships you’ve endured. I am pleased to hear all of Carcino is not our foe.

end.speaker: Klimt
end.line: I will depart at once for Frelia to explain our circumstance to the king. I think it is best if you return to Frelia as well. Pablo has considerable wealth, and he commands a vast mercenary force. I’m sure he’ll send more of them this way as soon as he is able.

end.speaker: Gerik
end.line: Prince Innes. Tethys and I are staying with you. Is that gonna work?

end.speaker: Innes
end.line: Yes, I would appreciate the help. Starting now, you’ve got a new contract, though–the pay’s double. If the two of you hadn’t stayed with me back there, I would not have survived. Gerik, Tethys... Thank you. You have my gratitude.

end.speaker: Tethys
end.line: Tell me something, Prince. Did you get...er...hit on the head during that last skirmish?

end.speaker: Innes
end.line: ...That’s unkind. My neck is not so stiff that I cannot show gratitude. I would ask for your continued support in the days ahead.

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: We both ask for your help.

end.speaker: Gerik
end.line: We’ve got a deal. Let’s keep each other alive.

end.speaker: Ewan
end.line: Ah! There you are, Sister.

end.speaker: Tethys
end.line: Ewan! How is it... What are you doing here? I told you to wait in the inn and behave yourself, didn’t I?

end.speaker: Ewan
end.line: Yeah, but you always run off and disappear. It’s not fair. I want to have adventures, too.

end.speaker: Tethys
end.line: You are such an imp... I am not out here running about having fun, you know?

end.speaker: Ewan
end.line: I know. That’s why I came to see you. I can help. My teacher finally got around to teaching me some magic. Check this out.

end.speaker: Tethys
end.line: H-hey! Knock it off! You shouldn’t be using magic here!

end.speaker: Ewan
end.line: Well, I just thought maybe I could help you work is all. I can protect you now, sis. Come on, take me with you. I don’t wanna stay in that inn anymore.

end.speaker: Tethys
end.line: Oh...all right. I’ll go speak and speak to the Chief and Princess Eirika. Don’t wander off while I’m gone.

end.speaker: Ewan
end.line: Yahoo!

end.speaker: Seth
end.line: Princess Eirika, Prince Innes. I think we should follow the advice we’ve been given and return to Frelia. Continuing on through Carcino like this is too great a risk to your safety.

end.speaker: Innes
end.line: The peril is self-evident. However, I have to reach Jehanna, and the only way is through Carcino. If I don’t hurry, nations will fall, one after another, to Grado’s hunger.

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: Innes is right. And the road to Rausten leads me through both Carcino and Jehanna. However, pressing on will only invite more mercenary attacks.

end.speaker: Ewan
end.line: Hey, I’ve got an answer. I know a way that leads over the mountains straight to Jehanna! Want me to guide you?

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: ...And who might you be?

end.speaker: Tethys
end.line: Ewan! Shush! You know better than to interrupt people when they’re talking. I’m so sorry. Please let me take my brother out of the way. Come on, Ewan. Let’s go.

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: No, no–wait, please. Do you really know a route through the mountains?

end.speaker: Ewan
end.line: That’s what I said. At the top of that mountain, there’s a village named Caer Pelyn. That’s where my teacher lives. I’m sure he’ll lead you through if you ask him nicely.

end.speaker: Innes
end.line: What is your teacher’s name?

end.speaker: Ewan
end.line: My teacher? His name is Saleh.

end.speaker: Innes
end.line: Saleh... I’ve heard that name on the lips of Frelia’s spy network lately. He’s a powerful wielder of magic who has been fighting bandits and monsters. The spies mentioned something about a Caer Pelyn, if I remember.

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: What do you think?

end.speaker: Innes
end.line: Hm. If my spies are accurate, this Saleh is someone we can trust.

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: Very well, Ewan. Will you take us to meet your teacher?

end.speaker: Tethys
end.line: Are you sure you can do this, Ewan?

end.speaker: Ewan
end.line: Not a problem! All right, everyone. See if you can keep up!
